question: President of India can nominate not more than two members of Anglo Indian Community in Lok Sabha if ___:
option1: President thinks that these members have contributed in the unity & integrity of nation
option2: President has opinion that the community is not adequately represented
option3: Supreme Court advises the President to do so
option4: Parliament has enacted a law in that effect
answer: President has opinion that the community is not adequately represented
explanation: Article 331: Notwithstanding anything in article 81, the President may, if he is of opinion that the Anglo-Indian community is not adequately represented in the House of the People, nominate not more than two members of that community to the House of the People.
